rename.from: curl -G --data-urlencode x / returns curl: (27) Out of memory
rename.to: curl -G --data x / returns curl: (27) Out of memory

issue.title: tool_operate: provide better errmsg for -G with bad URL

repository.name: curl
repository.description: A command line tool and library for transferring data with URL syntax, supporting DICT, FILE, FTP, FTPS, GOPHER, GOPHERS, HTTP, HTTPS, IMAP, IMAPS, LDAP, LDAPS, MQTT, POP3, POP3S, RTMP, RTMPS, RTSP, SCP, SFTP, SMB, SMBS, SMTP, SMTPS, TELNET, TFTP, WS and WSS. libcurl offers a myriad of powerful features

issue.body:
If the URL that -G would try to add a query to could not be parsed, it would display

 curl: (27) Out of memory

It now instead shows:

 curl: (2) Could not parse the URL, failed to set query

Reported-by: Alex Xu
Fixes #9889

body: Hm... as I understand, in new curl versions, https://stackoverflow.com/questions/296536/how-to-urlencode-data-for-curl-command/10797966 won't work anymore. Is there a better way to URL-encode some query string parameters and also send request body?

> Hm... as I understand, in new curl versions won't work anymore.

I don't understand what you say won't work anymore. We don't break behavior. Also, not really related to this bug.

sorry, I meant to link to https://stackoverflow.com/questions/296536/how-to-urlencode-data-for-curl-command/10797966#10797966. example:

    date | curl -Gso /dev/null -w %{url_effective} --data-urlencode @- "" | cut -c 3-
My points remain the same. Why wouldn't that work?

before b82eb72d8097c93313329a4aecd41317a293f506, `date | src/curl -Gso /dev/null -w %{url_effective} --data-urlencode @- "" | cut -c 3-` returns the current date with url encoding. after, it returns nothing.

body: `""` is not a valid URL. If you remove the `-s` you'll see the error message.

issue.title: --data --get with an invalid URL returns "Out of memory" error

repository.name: curl
repository.description: A command line tool and library for transferring data with URL syntax, supporting DICT, FILE, FTP, FTPS, GOPHER, GOPHERS, HTTP, HTTPS, IMAP, IMAPS, LDAP, LDAPS, MQTT, POP3, POP3S, RTMP, RTMPS, RTSP, SCP, SFTP, SMB, SMBS, SMTP, SMTPS, TELNET, TFTP, WS and WSS. libcurl offers a myriad of powerful features

issue.body:
### I did this

```
$ curl /localhost:8888 --data foo --get
curl: (27) Out of memory
$ curl //localhost:8888 --data foo --get
curl: (27) Out of memory
$ curl ///localhost:8888 --data foo --get
curl: (27) Out of memory
$ curl ////localhost:8888 --data foo --get
curl: (27) Out of memory
```

### I expected the following
An invalid URL error:

```
$ curl /localhost:8888
curl: (3) URL using bad/illegal format or missing URL
```

### curl/libcurl version

```
curl 7.86.0 (aarch64-apple-darwin22.1.0) libcurl/7.86.0 (SecureTransport) OpenSSL/1.1.1s zlib/1.2.11 brotli/1.0.9 zstd/1.5.2 libidn2/2.3.4 libssh2/1.10.0 nghttp2/1.51.0 librtmp/2.3
Release-Date: 2022-10-26
Protocols: dict file ftp ftps gopher gophers http https imap imaps ldap ldaps mqtt pop3 pop3s rtmp rtsp scp sftp smb smbs smtp smtps telnet tftp 
Features: alt-svc AsynchDNS brotli GSS-API HSTS HTTP2 HTTPS-proxy IDN IPv6 Kerberos Largefile libz MultiSSL NTLM NTLM_WB SPNEGO SSL threadsafe TLS-SRP UnixSockets zstd
```

### operating system

```
Darwin myhostname 22.1.0 Darwin Kernel Version 22.1.0: Sun Oct  9 20:14:30 PDT 2022; root:xnu-8792.41.9~2/RELEASE_ARM64_T8103 arm64 arm Darwin
```

I noticed this working on https://github.com/curlconverter/curlconverter/pull/487
